channel.title: Policy & Security Think Tank Updates
channel.description: Custom RSS feed from CSIS, CFR, and other policy institutions

item.title: PacTech Pulse: January 2026
item.description: This edition of PacTech Pulse covers January 2026.

item.title: U.S. Cyber Capabilities to Deter and Disrupt Malign Foreign Activity Targeting the Homeland
item.description: To actually achieve deterrence, the United States needs a mindset shift. We need to stop thinking about cyber attacks as inevitable nuisances and start seeing them for what they are: hostile action against the United States.

item.title: How Much More Oil from Venezuela—and How Soon?
item.description: Venezuelan oil production could rebound under adequate political, legal, fiscal, and operating conditions.

item.title: Would Air Strikes Against Iran Work?
item.description: History shows that air strikes alone struggle to achieve complex policy goals, but used in Iran now, they could trigger a domino effect that leads to the collapse of Iran's repressive authoritarian regime.

item.title: Leveraging Japan’s Appetite for U.S. Investment and Partnership in Pharmaceuticals and Biotechnology
item.description: The United States and Japan can strengthen their economic security and competitiveness by taking advantage of shared interests and new opportunities in the pharmaceuticals and biotechnology industries.

item.title: Securing the Future of the U.S. Biopharmaceutical Industry: The Most-Favored-Nation Paradox
item.description: The administration’s success in securing massive investment pledges from the industry to reshore manufacturing needs to be reinforced. Its positive impact will be undermined if the long-term consequence of its most-favored-nation pricing policy weakens the foundations of U.S. innovation.
